name: Japanese Curry
author: Adrien
description: Spicy, onion-y goodness straight from Japan

actions.step: Brown the chicken in a stainless steel stock pot on high heat with a splash of oil, salt, and pepper.
Remove the chicken from the pot and reserve. Don't worry about brown bits stuck to the bottom.
Add the onions and the chili peppers along with another splash of oil and salt.
Sautee the onions until brown, adding chicken stock or water if the contents of the pot are too dry.
Add reserved chicken, carrots, and potatoes.
Sautee briefly, then cover with water, measuring how much is added.
Bring water to a boil, skimming off any foam that rises to the top.
When the carrots are soft, add curry blocks according to the measured amount of water.
Adjust the thickness as needed with water.
Adjust the seasoning with salt or soy sauce.
